intro: Stylidium velleioides, commonly known as the velvetleaf stiltgrass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that are borne on short pedicels. It is often found in moist, disturbed soils in coastal and inland regions. Stylidium velleioides is adapted to thrive in environments with high humidity and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas.
